source.title: Getting started with Vercel
source.description: Platform overview covering account creation, authentication options, supported frontend frameworks, global infrastructure, development collaboration tools including preview and production environments, deployment comments, and CLI installation.

source.title: Getting Started | Step 1 of 8 - Projects and deployments
source.description: Core concepts defining projects as deployed applications with multiple deployments, and deployments as successful builds triggered by imports, Git commits, or CLI commands, each generating unique URLs automatically.

source.title: Getting Started | Step 2 of 8 - Use a template
source.description: Using Vercel templates to accelerate development, including finding templates, deploying to Vercel, connecting Git providers, automatic repository creation, deployment process, dashboard access, and local project cloning.

source.title: Getting Started | Step 3 of 8 - Import an existing project
source.description: Importing existing projects to Vercel via Git providers including GitHub, GitLab, and BitBucket, connecting repositories, configuring framework detection, build settings, environment variables, deployment process, and accessing deployed domains.

source.title: Getting Started | Step 4 of 8 - Add a domain
source.description: Custom domain setup for Vercel projects covering apex domains, subdomains, wildcard domains, domain purchasing, pointing existing domains to Vercel, domain transfers, and next steps for domain configuration.

source.title: Getting Started | Step 5 of 8 - Buy a domain
source.description: Purchasing domains on Vercel including marketplace search, TLD selection, premium domain pricing, cart checkout, payment details, ICANN registrant information, WHOIS privacy, auto-renewal, and domain configuration for projects.

source.title: Getting Started | Step 6 of 8 - Use an existing domain
source.description: Using existing domains with Vercel covering CLI commands, project domain settings, adding apex and subdomain configurations, DNS record setup including A records, CNAME records, TXT verification, and nameserver configuration methods.

source.title: Getting Started | Step 7 of 8 - Collaborate on Vercel
source.description: Collaboration workflow on Vercel including automatic Git deployments, production and preview environments, pull request integration, deployment inspection, sharing preview URLs, Comments feature for team feedback, and collaboration patterns.

source.title: Getting Started | Step 8 of 8 - Next Steps
source.description: Next steps overview covering infrastructure with Functions and CDN, storage products including Blob and Edge Config, observability tools for monitoring and analytics, and security features with HTTPS and DDoS mitigation.

source.title: Using the REST API - Vercel API Docs
source.description: Vercel REST API fundamentals covering HTTP/TLS server specs, JSON content-type requirements, bearer token authentication with access token creation and team scope, data types (ID, String, Integer, Float, Map, List, Enum, Date, IsoDate, Boolean), pagination with timestamp-based cursors, rate limits with headers, and endpoint versioning.

source.title: Integrations - Vercel API Docs
source.description: Integration management example demonstrating the Vercel SDK usage to list account integrations with the `getConfigurations` method, displaying integration slugs, installation types, and associated projects using bearer token authentication.

source.title: Vercel Hobby Plan
source.description: Vercel Hobby plan free tier limits (Edge Config reads/writes, CPU hours, provisioned memory, function invocations/duration, image optimisation, Speed Insights, Web Analytics), 30-day non-commercial billing, fair use restrictions, and Pro comparison.

source.title: AI SDK
source.description: Vercel AI SDK TypeScript toolkit overview covering AI SDK Core's unified API for text generation across providers (OpenAI, Anthropic), structured data generation with `generateObject` and `streamObject` using Zod schemas, tool calling integration for external systems, framework support (Next.js, Vue, Svelte, Node.js), and installation guide.

source.title: Vercel Pro Plan
source.description: Vercel Pro plan pricing covering $20/month platform fee with included deploying seat and monthly credit, credit-based billing for infrastructure resources (1TB Fast Data Transfer, 10M Edge Requests included), team seats (paid Owner/Member at $20/month, unlimited free Viewer seats), paid add-ons (SAML SSO, HIPAA BAA, Flags Explorer, Observability Plus), spend management, and Hobby downgrade process.

source.title: Spend Management
source.description: Vercel spend management for Pro plans covering spend amount configuration per billing cycle, automatic actions (notifications at 50%/75%/100%, webhook triggers, production deployment pausing), metered resource coverage, alert threshold notifications (web, email, SMS), project pausing/unpausing procedures, webhook payload structures, and activity logging.

source.title: Deploying to Vercel
source.description: Deployment methods via Git providers, Vercel CLI, Deploy Hooks, and REST API, accessing Local, Preview, and Production environments, dashboard resources tab, deployment summary, managing deployments, redeploying, and promoting to production.

source.title: Environments
source.description: Three environments (Local, Preview, Production) with CLI commands, environment variables, preview URLs, production workflows, and custom environments for Pro/Enterprise with branch tracking and domain configuration.

source.title: How to Build a Fullstack App with Next.js, Prisma, and Postgres
source.description: Step-by-step tutorial for building a fullstack blogging application with Next.js, Prisma ORM, Vercel Postgres, NextAuth.js GitHub OAuth, implementing CRUD operations for post creation, publishing, deletion, and deploying to Vercel.

source.title: How do I generate a “sitemap.xml” for my Next.js app on Vercel?
source.description: Generating sitemap.xml for Next.js App Router using the sitemap file convention, including URL configuration with lastModified, changeFrequency, and priority fields for build-time generation.

source.title: How can I run end-to-end tests after my Vercel Preview Deployment?
source.description: Running end-to-end tests after Vercel preview deployments using GitHub Actions repository_dispatch events or webhooks, including workflow configuration, deployment protection bypass for automation, and Playwright integration.

source.title: Next.js on Vercel
source.description: Next.js deployment on Vercel including ISR, SSR, streaming, image and font optimization, OG image generation, Middleware, Draft Mode, Web Analytics, Speed Insights, and service integrations.

source.title: Production checklist for launch
source.description: Production launch checklist covering operational excellence, security with WAF and deployment protection, reliability with observability and caching, performance optimization for images and functions, and cost management with spend monitoring.

source.title: Getting started with Speed Insights
source.description: Speed Insights quickstart covering prerequisites, enabling via dashboard, installing @vercel/speed-insights package, adding SpeedInsights component to Next.js app router layouts, deploying to Vercel, and viewing metrics data.

source.title: Speed Insights Configuration with @vercel/speed-insights
source.description: @vercel/speed-insights package configuration options including sampleRate for event sampling, beforeSend for filtering sensitive data, debug mode, route aggregation, custom endpoint URLs, and scriptSrc for script loading.

source.title: Speed Insights Metrics
source.description: Core Web Vitals metrics including LCP, CLS, INP, FCP, FID, TBT, and TTFB with target values, Real Experience Score calculation, percentile definitions, score interpretation, and Virtual Experience Score.

source.title: Getting started with Vercel Web Analytics
source.description: Quickstart guide for Vercel Web Analytics: enabling analytics in dashboard, installing @vercel/analytics package, adding Analytics component to root layout, deploying to Vercel, and viewing visitor data in the dashboard.

source.title: Advanced Web Analytics Config with @vercel/analytics
source.description: @vercel/analytics package configuration including mode for environment detection, debug logging, beforeSend hook for event filtering and data redaction, custom endpoint for multi-project domains, and scriptSrc for custom script URLs.

source.title: Tracking custom events
source.description: Tracking custom events with track() function for client-side and server-side events, passing custom data properties, event naming limitations, and viewing tracked events in the Vercel dashboard.

source.title: Filtering Analytics
source.description: Filtering Web Analytics data by routes, pages, hostname, referrers, UTM parameters, country, browsers, devices, and OS. Includes drill-downs for referrers, feature flags, custom events, and Twitter resolver for t.co traffic.

source.title: Protection Bypass for Automation
source.description: Bypassing deployment protection for E2E testing automation using x-vercel-protection-bypass header with generated secret, x-vercel-set-bypass-cookie for follow-up requests, SameSite configuration for iframes, and Playwright example.

source.title: Deployment Protection on Vercel
source.description: Overview of Deployment Protection features: Vercel Authentication, Password Protection, Trusted IPs, Standard Protection, All Deployments, production-only protection, legacy options, Advanced Deployment Protection add-on for Pro plans.

source.title: Vercel Authentication
source.description: Vercel Authentication deployment protection restricting access to logged-in team members, project members, and access groups, with access request workflow, approval management via dashboard and API, security considerations, and Terraform configuration.

source.title: Deploying GitHub Projects with Vercel
source.description: GitHub integration for automatic deployments, preview URLs, fork protection, production rollbacks, silencing bot comments, GitHub Actions CI/CD with vercel build/deploy, repository_dispatch events, VERCEL_GIT_* environment variables, and permission scopes.
